N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 162.3 - Assistance available for performing controlled blasting operations

State Regulations
(a) If a county or
town superintendent determines that he needs the assistance of the Department
of Transportation in order to perform controlled blasting operations that would
meet the requirements contained in 12 NYCRR Part
39, for improvement or
maintenance of roads within his jurisdiction, he may make a written request or
such assistance to the regional director of the region in which his county or
town is located, in a format to be supplied by the department. Such request
shall contain an agreement on behalf of the county or town to obtain protective
liability insurance to indemnify and save harmless the State of New York, its
officers, agents and employees from claims, suits, actions, damages and costs
of every name and description resulting from the blasting operations requested
to be performed. It shall also contain a description of the work requested to
be performed, identifying the road on which the operation is to be performed
and the location and general area on such road where the activity is to be
performed, and such other information and data as the department shall
require. (b) The department shall
review the request. It may refuse the request, or it may agree to assist the
county or town in its blasting operations. If the department determines that it
will assist the county or town by assigning a department employee to perform
the blasting operation requested by the county or town, the county or town
shall obtain the protective liability insurance coverage agreed to in the
request, in an amount to be determined by the department, to indemnify and save
harmless the State of New York, its officers, agents and employees from claims, suits, actions, damages and costs of every name and description resulting from
the blasting operations that were the subject of the request. (c) The protective liability insurance shall
remain in existence for the duration of the blasting operations and shall
provide that the policy, and/or the rider adding the State of New York as a
party to be protected by such insurance policy, shall not be cancelled until
the department has given the county or town superintendent written notice that
the blasting operations performed by the department have been completed and
that the insurance coverage is no longer required. (d) Certification that the required insurance
has been obtained shall be furnished to the regional director prior to the
performance of the blasting operation by the Department of Transportation
employee. Notes
